message: ok so the question is then is the 404 harmfull ?
im just scared that because of some experimenting from me a group gets flooded with bot output which would be a bad thing as i dont want to offend any users or something
I'm just trying out to use convore with my bot and i occured to me that my bot can post to any group it has a groupid for .. is this intended ?

2011-04-16 16:21:01,949 - default-convore - topics/#alphaonelabs/messages/create.json - {'pasted': True, 'message': u'[!] CONVORE_USER_bthate (bthate) - owner - it works!'} returned code 404 - <BotEventRunner._loop+bot-post:50>
sorry was just an old relay configuration of my bot
yeah its a nasty business to get that correct
this request was mainly so my bot wouldnt flood a channel unwanted
not that i have that evil intend ;]
good to know convore works this way though thanks for the clarification ;]
i dont know thats kinda why i ask here ;]
just know the convore API for 4 days now or so ?
not gonna test it anyways but hee ;]
you know if by any change the server is going to be opensource with some sort of fedaration builtin / ;]]
from my limited experiments with bots and the live api the live api updates only with messages for groups for which the bot is a member of
bots mostly respond to commands, so if it uses the live api there's no risk of mistakenly responding in another group/topic
you can post if you're not a member, unless it's private
so that's how convore works, the api just works by the rules
why?
i think i remember this happening .. bot joins group and after i let it part the group it can still post to the group ?
one can register a bot and flood all the public groups
hmm same problem wave had i guess
yeah, async networking stuff is difficult in python I gues. Not as difficult as in java maybe, but still
it has a concept similar to threads
only lightweight and suitable for this kind of stuff
my bot can also push to topic and groups
think RSS feeds and relaying etc
as a user I think you can post to a group even if you have not joined, unless it's private, right?
yeah
well yeah, unless it's private you pretty much can abuse any group
either with or without the api
even if such restriction existed, one could simply make the bot join a group through the api and still flood
because of the must not block mantra
i had something like that when i was devving the convore part of the bot
i implemented a chan-enable command to let the bot be able to send to a topic
i do that fortunately ;]
i dont think you should be able to post on public groups when your now a member put not sure if it is that way
thats not good
anyone can flood a group like this
just make sure it responds to the channel where the command came from, and if it does something like you do for the live comp.lang.python updates... well dunno, I can't imagine all the use cases
